<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/the-world-is-getting-worried-about-covid-again?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The World Is Getting Worried About Covid Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/the-world-is-getting-worried-about-covid-again?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A Delta Air Lines plane lands near a COVID-19 testing sign at Los Angeles International Airport" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9f4dd83af96934bce83aefb5715dd4cc6cf4f5ee-1024x630.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mario Tama/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From Crypto.com Arena to Adele’s new album, there were plenty of distractions this week from the more sobering news that Covid-19 is once again rearing its spiky head, forcing lockdowns, moving markets, and creating more urgency around the rollout of booster shots. Here’s a quick roundup.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Unleash the booster shots: </strong>The CDC attempted to simplify the confusing patchwork of rules around booster shot eligibility by announcing that anyone 18 or older <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-centers-for-disease-control-and-prevention-34aabde2c1c5a88c7763fa1dac77df5f?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can get one</a>, provided they received their second dose of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine at least six months ago.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>12 states had already opened up boosters to all adults due to concerns about rising case numbers over the last two weeks. A study from Pfizer and BioNTech showed that boosters restore immunity against symptomatic infections to about 95%.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lockdowns are back: </strong>Austria became the first country in Western Europe to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/austria-imposes-full-lockdown-germany-may-follow-covid-grips-europe-2021-11-19/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reimpose a full lockdown</a>, which starts Monday and will last for at least 10 days. Austria has one of the lowest vaccination rates in Western Europe (about 64%, still higher than the US), and its infection rates are among the highest on the continent.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Germany isn’t ruling out another lockdown, either. “We are in a national emergency,” the country’s health minister said of a surge in cases.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Oil prices are dropping: </strong>News of Austria’s lockdown sent oil prices falling yesterday to a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/19/oil-falls-to-six-week-low-on-lockdown-concerns.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">six-week low</a>, as investors fret that demand for fuel could dry up with Covid spreading. That may be welcome relief to Americans paying an average of $3.41/gallon at the pump, but it could take a while for lower oil prices to trickle down to your local Hess.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Travel stocks are falling: </strong>Shares in travel companies like Carnival, United, and American Airlines have all dipped this week due to...all of the above.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>rising Covid cases do not seem to be scaring Americans away from <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/19/thanksgiving-travel-20-million-travelers-expected-to-test-airlines.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">heading home</a> for Thanksgiving. The TSA expects the number of airline passengers over Thanksgiving week to nearly match 2019 levels.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/18/cost-of-thanksgiving-meal-up-14-this-year?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Do Macy's Balloons and Your Thanksgiving Meal Have in Common?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/18/cost-of-thanksgiving-meal-up-14-this-year?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Thanksgiving meal represented as a parade float" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7f0db62945ef8972301a44a27aa5c12cf4dd2a99-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This Thanksgiving, we’re grateful that inflation will be the topic of convo instead of our dating life. The cost of a traditional Thanksgiving meal is up <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/11/18/1056809650/thanksgiving-turkey-prices-inflation-farm-bureau?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">14% this year</a> to $53.31 for a group of 10 people (a little under $6 per person), according to a survey conducted by the Farm Bureau. That's the biggest annual increase in 31 years.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A 16-pound turkey costs $23.99, up 24% from last year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two frozen pie crusts rose 20% to $2.91 this year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And a dozen dinner rolls were up 15% from 2020, rolling in at $3.05.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The $53.31 price tag comes with an asterisk: The Farm Bureau’s survey was administered between October 28 and November 8, before deals on frozen turkeys (the most expensive Thanksgiving menu item) hit grocery stores. The average frozen turkey price has actually fallen from $1.50/lb to $0.88 over the last week. The opposite of an early bird special.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, food prices <em>have</em> jumped considerably this year due to supply chain snags and higher demand. Tyson Foods said that pork prices jumped 38% and chicken prices gained 19% last quarter. Food prices overall increased 5.3% annually in October, per the Bureau of Labor Statistics.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/miramax-sues-tarantino-over-pulp-fiction-nfts?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Royale With NFTs
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/miramax-sues-tarantino-over-pulp-fiction-nfts?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Samuel Jackson in Pulp Fiction" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=285 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-19/image-d0a69b5b6881c06c462b6f401f894d32b6f1b762-480x204-gif/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Samuel Jackson in Pulp Fiction" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2021-11-19/image-d0a69b5b6881c06c462b6f401f894d32b6f1b762-480x204-gif/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Miramax, the studio behind <em>Pulp Fiction</em>, sued director Quentin Tarantino this week for planning to sell NFTs related to the iconic film. Tarantino replied, to paraphrase, “I don’t remember asking you a gd thing.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The scuffle brings questions about ownership and intellectual property to the forefront of NFT watercooler chats.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>At the NFT.NYC conference earlier this month, Tarantino announced his plan to sell NFTs of his first handwritten drafts of <em>Pulp Fiction</em>’s screenplay. Within days, Miramax sent Tarantino a cease-and-desist letter that <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/17/business/miramax-tarantino-nft-pulp-fiction.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the director ignored</a>—prompting the studio to sue him over copyright infringement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From Miramax’s POV, Tarantino does not own the rights to his <em>Pulp Fiction</em> scripts and thereby cannot sell them, even as digital tokens. But according to Tarantino’s lawyer Bryan Freedman, “Miramax is wrong—plain and simple.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Legal experts say whoever owns the copyright of an asset has the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/21/nfts-intellectual-property-really-means-digital-kitty?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">right to sell</a> an NFT of it, but creative projects that involve numerous assets don’t always have a clear contract of who owns what. Expect this to be the first of many high-profile squabbles over NFT rights in the future.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/key-performance-indicators-november-20?mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/key-performance-indicators-november-20?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Ken Griffin" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/491bd937e3cb7c7dbb5f39a36838a37c77549a4e-1024x700.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael Kovac/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“No. Freaking. Way.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That was pretty much the response of everyone when they <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/citadel-ceo-ken-griffin-outbid-a-group-of-crypto-investors-for-copy-of-u-s-constitution-11637352087?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found out</a> that the person who outbid a group of crypto investors to buy a copy of the Constitution was none other than...Ken Griffin. The billionaire CEO of the hedge fund Citadel is a favorite target of individual traders, so this purchase is being billed as the ultimate troll move. Griffin said he’d lend the document, which cost him $43.2 million, to a free museum in Arkansas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>In an attempt to delay the Build Back Better bill from a vote, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy took the floor at 8:38pm Thursday night and talked for <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/11/19/1057199952/gop-leader-mccarthy-spoke-for-more-than-8-hours-to-delay-passage-of-spending-bil?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">8 hours and 32 minutes</a>, the longest House speech in modern history. But only a few hours after he yielded the floor early Friday morning, the House <a href="https://apnews.com/article/climate-immigration-joe-biden-health-lifestyle-bff841da156cb12cd47a564f9e0267eb?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">passed</a> the $1.75 trillion social and climate spending bill, 220–213, sending it to the Senate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The notorious Mrs. Mossler. (<a href="https://www.texasmonthly.com/news-politics/the-notorious-mrs-mossler/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Texas Monthly</a>)</p>
</div>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">

</font></a>

</td>

<a href="https://link.chtbl.com/4wUfwP-l?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Treat Your Ears " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/be28cc6ecd5ba8c610c43b33a149648b01659f48-1280x1276.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Start your day in-the-know by catching up on the lates<em>t <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/4wUfwP-l?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Business Casual</a></em> episodes:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How CEO Anjali Sud turned Vimeo into a </span><span><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Hd2ZrWvs?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">billion dollar company</a></span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The business behind airports & </span><span><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/ApD7LTPU?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">what it’s like to live in one</a></span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Are </span><span><a href="https://link.chtbl.com/QsP6M7a6?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tiny homes</a></span><span> solving a big problem for veterans?</span>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe World Is Getting Worried About Covid Again\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/19/the-world-is-getting-worried-about-covid-again?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A Delta Air Lines plane lands near a COVID-19 testing sign at Los Angeles International Airport\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9f4dd83af96934bce83aefb5715dd4cc6cf4f5ee-1024x630.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMario Tama/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom Crypto.com Arena to Adele’s new album, there were plenty of distractions this week from the more sobering news that Covid-19 is once again rearing its spiky head, forcing lockdowns, moving markets, and creating more urgency around the rollout of booster shots. Here’s a quick roundup.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnleash the booster shots: \u003c/strong\u003eThe CDC attempted to simplify the confusing patchwork of rules around booster shot eligibility by announcing that anyone 18 or older \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-science-business-health-centers-for-disease-control-and-prevention-34aabde2c1c5a88c7763fa1dac77df5f?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan get one\u003c/a\u003e, provided they received their second dose of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine at least six months ago.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e12 states had already opened up boosters to all adults due to concerns about rising case numbers over the last two weeks. A study from Pfizer and BioNTech showed that boosters restore immunity against symptomatic infections to about 95%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLockdowns are back: \u003c/strong\u003eAustria became the first country in Western Europe to \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/markets/europe/austria-imposes-full-lockdown-germany-may-follow-covid-grips-europe-2021-11-19/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereimpose a full lockdown\u003c/a\u003e, which starts Monday and will last for at least 10 days. Austria has one of the lowest vaccination rates in Western Europe (about 64%, still higher than the US), and its infection rates are among the highest on the continent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGermany isn’t ruling out another lockdown, either. “We are in a national emergency,” the country’s health minister said of a surge in cases.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOil prices are dropping: \u003c/strong\u003eNews of Austria’s lockdown sent oil prices falling yesterday to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/19/oil-falls-to-six-week-low-on-lockdown-concerns.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esix-week low\u003c/a\u003e, as investors fret that demand for fuel could dry up with Covid spreading. That may be welcome relief to Americans paying an average of $3.41/gallon at the pump, but it could take a while for lower oil prices to trickle down to your local Hess.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTravel stocks are falling: \u003c/strong\u003eShares in travel companies like Carnival, United, and American Airlines have all dipped this week due to...all of the above.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003erising Covid cases do not seem to be scaring Americans away from \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/19/thanksgiving-travel-20-million-travelers-expected-to-test-airlines.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheading home\u003c/a\u003e for Thanksgiving. The TSA expects the number of airline passengers over Thanksgiving week to nearly match 2019 levels.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/18/cost-of-thanksgiving-meal-up-14-this-year?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis Thanksgiving, we’re grateful that inflation will be the topic of convo instead of our dating life. The cost of a traditional Thanksgiving meal is up \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/11/18/1056809650/thanksgiving-turkey-prices-inflation-farm-bureau?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e14% this year\u003c/a\u003e to $53.31 for a group of 10 people (a little under $6 per person), according to a survey conducted by the Farm Bureau. That's the biggest annual increase in 31 years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA 16-pound turkey costs $23.99, up 24% from last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo frozen pie crusts rose 20% to $2.91 this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd a dozen dinner rolls were up 15% from 2020, rolling in at $3.05.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe $53.31 price tag comes with an asterisk: The Farm Bureau’s survey was administered between October 28 and November 8, before deals on frozen turkeys (the most expensive Thanksgiving menu item) hit grocery stores. The average frozen turkey price has actually fallen from $1.50/lb to $0.88 over the last week. The opposite of an early bird special.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, food prices \u003cem\u003ehave\u003c/em\u003e jumped considerably this year due to supply chain snags and higher demand. Tyson Foods said that pork prices jumped 38% and chicken prices gained 19% last quarter. Food prices overall increased 5.3% annually in October, per the Bureau of Labor Statistics.—\u003cem\u003eMM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMiramax, the studio behind \u003cem\u003ePulp Fiction\u003c/em\u003e, sued director Quentin Tarantino this week for planning to sell NFTs related to the iconic film. Tarantino replied, to paraphrase, “I don’t remember asking you a gd thing.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe scuffle brings questions about ownership and intellectual property to the forefront of NFT watercooler chats.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAt the NFT.NYC conference earlier this month, Tarantino announced his plan to sell NFTs of his first handwritten drafts of \u003cem\u003ePulp Fiction\u003c/em\u003e’s screenplay. Within days, Miramax sent Tarantino a cease-and-desist letter that \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/17/business/miramax-tarantino-nft-pulp-fiction.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe director ignored\u003c/a\u003e—prompting the studio to sue him over copyright infringement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom Miramax’s POV, Tarantino does not own the rights to his \u003cem\u003ePulp Fiction\u003c/em\u003e scripts and thereby cannot sell them, even as digital tokens. But according to Tarantino’s lawyer Bryan Freedman, “Miramax is wrong—plain and simple.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eLegal experts say whoever owns the copyright of an asset has the \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/21/nfts-intellectual-property-really-means-digital-kitty?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eright to sell\u003c/a\u003e an NFT of it, but creative projects that involve numerous assets don’t always have a clear contract of who owns what. Expect this to be the first of many high-profile squabbles over NFT rights in the future.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable The billionaire CEO of the hedge fund Citadel is a favorite target of individual traders, so this purchase is being billed as the ultimate troll move. Griffin said he’d lend the document, which cost him $43.2 million, to a free museum in Arkansas.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStat: \u003c/strong\u003eIn an attempt to delay the Build Back Better bill from a vote, House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy took the floor at 8:38pm Thursday night and talked for \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/11/19/1057199952/gop-leader-mccarthy-spoke-for-more-than-8-hours-to-delay-passage-of-spending-bil?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e8 hours and 32 minutes\u003c/a\u003e, the longest House speech in modern history. But only a few hours after he yielded the floor early Friday morning, the House \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/climate-immigration-joe-biden-health-lifestyle-bff841da156cb12cd47a564f9e0267eb?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epassed\u003c/a\u003e the $1.75 trillion social and climate spending bill, 220–213, sending it to the Senate.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRead: \u003c/strong\u003eThe notorious Mrs. Mossler.
